Question_1.Context: The paper discusses the use of machine learning in theoretical materials science.
Question_1.Question: What is the main goal of continuum mechanics?
Question_1.A: To establish the macroscopic response to a stimulus in a given geometry for a certain material.
Question_1.B: To derive governing equations from first principles starting from a microscopic description.
Question_1.C: To predict molecular properties using machine learning techniques.
Question_1.D: To develop accurate density functional theory force fields.
Question_1.Source: The common goal of continuum mechanics is to establish the macroscopic response to a stimulus in a given geometry for a certain material.

Question_2.Context: The paper discusses the limitations of traditional approaches in mechanics.
Question_2.Question: What is a limitation of fitting data with trial functions?
Question_2.A: Humans are able to visualize data fitting in more than three dimensions.
Question_2.B: It is limited by a bias regarding the functional relations.
Question_2.C: It performs well for non-linear patterns.
Question_2.Source: The second approach is limited by a bias regarding the functional relations.

Question_3.Context: The paper discusses the workflow of machine learning in physics and mechanics.
Question_3.Question: What is the typical modus operandi in machine learning?
Question_3.A: To predict a target Y with features X by maximizing the cost function C.
Question_3.B: To split the available data into training and test sets.
Question_3.C: To choose features X based on general symmetry considerations.
Question_3.D: To minimize the cost function C with respect to the trainable parameters α.
Question_3.Source: The typical modus operandi in ML is to split the available data in training and test sets.

Question_4.Context: The paper discusses machine learning applications in dislocation dynamics and crystal plasticity.
Question_4.Question: What is the hierarchical simulation workflow in dislocations-based plasticity?
Question_4.A: To describe dislocation pattern formation on a macroscopic scale.
Question_4.B: To pass parameters from lower scale models to higher scale theories.
Question_4.C: To predict the stress-strain behavior of individual samples.
Question_4.D: To develop mod- els incorporating characteristics of lower scale simulations.
Question_4.Source: The hierarchical simulation workflow is to pass parameters from the lower scale models to higher scale theories.

Question_5.Context: The paper discusses machine learning applications in atomistic glasses.
Question_5.Question: What was the goal of the first approach by Cubuk et al. (2015) in predicting plastically deformed atoms?
Question_5.A: To predict the stress-strain behavior of individual samples.
Question_5.B: To classify whether an atom's non-affine displacement has exceeded a certain threshold.
Question_5.C: To predict the microstructure evolution of the center voxel in a cube.
Question_5.D: To construct short and medium range features from interstice distributions.
Question_5.Source: The first approach was based on the use of symmetry functions to classify whether an atom's non-affine displacement has exceeded a certain threshold.

Question_6.Context: The paper discusses the discovery of functions and partial differential equations from data.
Question_6.Question: What is the basic mathematical assumption to the model for discovering governing equations?
Question_6.A: To look for an approximation of f.
Question_6.B: To construct a collection of possible functions.
Question_6.Source: The basic mathematical assumption to the model is that we are interested in the time evolution of some quantity ˙X = f (X) and look for an approximation of f.

Question_7.Context: The paper discusses the use of machine learning in mechanics and physics-related questions.
Question_7.Question: What is a disadvantage of using deep learning approaches in machine learning?
Question_7.A: They are very accurate in many applications.
Question_7.B: They remain often quite difficult to interpret.
Question_7.D: They are optimal with respect to performance.
Question_7.Source: In contrast, decision trees or even linear regression models are much easier to understand than deep learning but are far from optimal with respect to performance.

Question_8.Context: The paper discusses the successful applications of machine learning in recent years.
Question_8.Question: What is highlighted as vital when applying machine learning to mechanics/physics-related questions?
Question_8.A: Increasing accuracy without focusing on interpretability.
Question_8.B: Incorporating the underlying symmetry of the physical problem.
Question_8.D: Ignoring the use of interpretable features and estimators.
Question_8.Source: In our opinion, it is vital to incorporate the underlying symmetry of the physical problem in the ML model in order to build a stable model with fewer training data.

Question_9.Context: The paper discusses the limitations of applying machine learning methods to experiments.
Question_9.Question: What is a major difficulty in applying machine learning methods to 2D/3D data from experiments?
Question_9.A: Parts of the information are limited by the precision of the measurement and noise.
Question_9.B: The missing dimension will not affect the prediction.
Question_9.C: The analysis will be quantitative by nature.
Question_9.D: The missing dimension will not render the prediction impossible.
Question_9.Source: Parts of the information are limited by the precision of the measurement and noise.

Question_10.Context: The paper discusses the conclusion regarding the successful applications of machine learning in various fields.
Question_10.Question: What is the promise of combining first principles and data science in expanding knowledge?
Question_10.A: To focus solely on increasing accuracy.
Question_10.B: To use interpretable features and estimators.
Question_10.C: To develop novel data-driven materials theories.
Question_10.D: To ignore the underlying symmetry of the physical problem.
Question_10.Source: This combination of first principles and data science promises to be a highly rewarding endeavour to expand our knowledge and develop novel data-driven materials theories.
